content: Let’s walk through the key clues and how they pinpoint this exact spot:

title: 1. Architectural style and ornamentation
content:
- The façade features richly detailed Beaux-Arts elements: sculpted figures above the windows, pilasters, balustrades, and a central clock flanked by statuary.
   - The four corner domes with multicolored mosaic tiling are distinctive to the famous Monte-Carlo Casino building designed by Charles Garnier.

title: 2. Roof mosaics and cupolas
content:
- The patterned tiles (greens, yellows, blues) forming geometric panels on the domes are unique to the Casino de Monte-Carlo’s roof.
   - The small lantern-topped cupolas (two on the sides, one central) match photographs of the casino’s skyline silhouette.

title: 3. Surrounding objects and ambiance
content:
- Palm trees lining the entrance forecourt.
   - High-end luxury cars parked in front (Bentleys, Lamborghinis), indicative of Monaco’s prestige setting.
   - Ornate lamp-posts and wrought-iron fencing framing a small plaza in front of the casino.

title: 4. Crowd and event context
content: - A dense crowd gathering in the square, suggesting a tourist hotspot and event-style set-up, typical of the Place du Casino.
All these clues converge on the same place: the casino entrance on Place du Casino, the main plaza in the Monte-Carlo district of Monaco.

title: **Location Conclusion**
content: Place du Casino (Casino Square), Monte-Carlo, Monaco
